clinical_study.brief_title: Brown Adipose Tissue Activity and Energy Metabolism in Cachexia
clinical_study.official_title: Brown Adipose Tissue Activity and Energy Metabolism in Cachexia Induced by Cancer or Chronic Disease

brief_summary.textblock: To study BAT activity and energy metabolism in patients with cachexia induced by cancer or chronic disease.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a prospective, cross-sectional study to determine BAT activity in cachectic patients with pancreatic or non-small cell lung cancer, and in cachectic patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), and compare results with healthy individuals and non-cachectic COPD patients, matched for age and BMI.

primary_outcome.measure: Brown adipose tissue (BAT) activity measured by PET(-MRI)
primary_outcome.time_frame: participants will be followed for 2 weeks
primary_outcome.description: The main endpoint of this study is BAT volume and intensity of activity in Standard Uptake Value (SUV) in the presence of cancer cachexia, COPD cachexia, and compared to non-cachectic COPD patients and healthy individuals, as assessed by 18F-fluoro-deoxyglucose (18F-FDG) PET-MRI scanning.

secondary_outcome.measure: Total energy metabolism measured by resting energy expenditure (REE) and doubly labeled water
secondary_outcome.time_frame: participants will be followed for 2 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Resting metabolic rate measured by REE
secondary_outcome.time_frame: participants will be followed for 2 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Metabolic gene expression in WAT measured by biopsy of subcutaneous fat

secondary_outcome.measure: Systemic inflammatory status measured in blood
secondary_outcome.time_frame: participants will be followed for 2 weeks

secondary_outcome.time_frame: participants will be followed for 2 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Detailed body composition phenotyping of cachexia by (PET-)MRI to compare with commonly applied clinical measures (D2O and DXA)
